intro: Thlaspi hastulatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces small, yellow flowers and has palmate leaves that are divided into lobes. Thlaspi hastulatum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
